section.title: Workspace
section.para: The workspace is a directory where information can be stored by Purifinity. These information are settings, current UI layouts and others which simplify the work with Purifinity for the user. During the first startup and if configured Purifinity asks for a workspace directory which is to be used. It is possible that way to organize the own work and to keep the focus on singular projects.

section.title: An Example Usage Scenario
section.para: As a quality manager it is possibly needed to keep an eye on the source code quality of multiple projects which is also contains multiple modules or libraries. In this case it is possible to keep a single workspace for each of the different software projects. The different modules or libraries are organized than into different analysis projects.

Depending on the current focus, the workspace can be selected with the Switch Workspace functionality. Additionally, it is also possible to run multiple instances of Purifinity on different workspaces.

section.title: Limitation
section.para: It is not possible to run multiple instances of Purifinity on a single workspace. It is also not really meaningful. During startup Purifinity will complain as soon as another instance locks the selected workspace.
